turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Dreata.
turn.2: Dreata Dreata is a monotypic moth genus in the family Eupterotidae described by Francis Walker in 1855.
turn.4: Its single species, Dreata hades, described by the same author in the same year, is found in Bangladesh, Myanmar and India.
turn.8: The forewings are mouse brown, with the medial area pale.
turn.10: There are five indistinct waved lines, a nearly straight and erect prominent postmedial line and a waved submarginal line.
turn.11: What do the hindwings look like?
turn.12: The hindwings are pale at the base, without the waved lines.
